Posts.Title: I never wanted to post here, but what do I do now?? AlaskaDeb heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2008 10:17PM trk_koa wrote: Mine was on October of 2005. As I recall, the shots are just like shots - not fun but okay. The core needle will be guided by the ultrasound so that it goes directly into the suspicious tissue. So it depends how deep that suspicious tissue is. I had multiple tumors but they were very close to each other so they only went in from one spot. I remember being uncomfortable a bit and kept my eyes closed. I could see the monitor if I wanted, but I'm squeamish. I don't remember pain when the anesthetic wore off and I do not have a scar. Went home with just a band aid. Hope this helps, Nancy
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy w/ U/S, what to expect? CorasMama Jo_Ann_K

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 05:16PM trk_koa wrote: I had this procedure last Monday, a week ago today. The wire thing was what had me the most nervous and it turned out to be fine. The wire itself was probably no thicker than a few strands of hair. It doesn't hurt being in there. I had about a two hourÂ delay waiting for the OR and with the gauze and tape over it, I wasn't even aware of it. I thought a core-needle biopsy was much more uncomfortable, to be honest. You have already braved that. I got good news about mine (B9 sclerosing adenosis) and hope you will be as fortunate. And once it is removed, it won't be there to worry about any more. Be sure to let us know what happens. We'll be thinking about you and sending good vibes your way.
